A way of doing business. Our vertically integrated investment platform has deep expertise in real estate investment, development, and operations, enabling us to capture attractive risk-adjusted returns throughout the entire real estate investment lifecycle. Reef Investments combines institutional-quality standards with entrepreneurial agility, managing a substantial portfolio of investments across diverse strategies in credit, equity, and opportunistic real estate. Our success stems from our ability to identify opportunities, structure creative solutions, and strategically align our capital with our investors to create lasting value. With over $2 billion in development projects across destinations like Deer Valley, Park City, Black Desert Resort, Lake Anna, Hawaii, and Telluride, we’ve built a reputation for outstanding vision and world-class execution. Our deep respect for these beautiful places drives us to preserve them for generations while actively supporting local communities. Our team brings decades of expertise in real estate private credit, private equity, and investment management. We align our own capital with investor capital to provide competitive returns across diverse investment strategies. At Reef, we’re more than just a business — we’re a highly experienced team that treats people as we wish to be treated: with respect, loyalty, and trust. From our investors and partners to our members and employees, we live by one simple principle: expect the best. Learn About Reef CP Leadership Careers Contact Us Discover More Leadership Careers Contact info@reefcp.com 2600 N Ashton Blvd #200, Lehi, UT 84048 Investments Real Estate Lifestyle About Us Leadership Careers Contact ©Reef Capital Partners 2025. About Us – Red River Ranch 435-425-3322 | thelodge@redriverranch.com | Our weather today is: Skip to Main Content Resort About Us Contact Us Image Gallery Stay Our Rooms Amenities Dine Our Restaurant Area Dining Gather Weddings Retreats Reunions Explore Adventures Capitol Reef Itineraries Our Blog Reserve Now Reserve Now 435-425-3322 | thelodge@redriverranch.com Red River Ranch About Us Red River Ranch About Us Our Story. About the Lodge. The Lodge Designed to evoke the memory of the Old West, The Lodge at Red River Ranch has been welcoming guests to rustic comfort for over 30 years. We are the premier luxury hotel of Capitol Reef. The Lodge was constructed with heavy log framing and elegant furnishings to create a truly unique and inviting atmosphere. The focal point of the Lodge is our three-story Great Room â a warm and relaxing space that instantly feels like home. Here guests can play, mingle, or lounge after a day of exploration. Our fifteen unique guest rooms and suites are tastefully decorated with antique furnishings and authentic decor, and each room is complete with its own fireplace. The Bison Perhaps the greatest symbol of the Old West is the American Bison. Herds of bison once roamed over the plains and mountains of the West. We at Red River Ranch are privileged to raise bison in a sustainable fashion on 2,000 acres of pristine pasture land. Guests are encouraged to admire and photograph our bison from behind the fences, but please do not approach them. Capitol Reef The Lodge at Red River Ranch is located on historic Utah Highway 24, standing at the gateway to the unspoiled Capitol Reef National Park. Capitol Reef is something of a secret, even to native Utahans. But those lucky travelers who visit the park never forget the time the spend there, the trails they hike, and the breathtaking scenery. The Lodge is also located a convenient distance from other major national parks, like Bryce Canyon and Zion. Both only a day-trip away. We invite you to come experience Capitol Reef, to relish your stay at the Lodge, and to capture the ineffable spirit of the Old West. â The Lodge at Red River Ranch Reserve Now 435-425-3322 Get to know us. Leadership — Red Reef Partners 0 Skip to Content Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability LP Login Open Menu Close Menu Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability LP Login Open Menu Close Menu Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability LP Login Working with aligned teams of experienced investment and operating professionals committed to our stakeholders. Pioneers in professional farmland investing, our team has decades of experience serving institutional investors and generating attractive returns through wide-ranging market conditions. Suzanne Petrela Managing Partner & Chief Investment Officer Bio Suzanne Petrela founded Red Reef and leads the firm’s investment management business, including commingled funds and customized accounts, and strategic partnerships in agronomy, agricultural technology, and renewable energy. Ms. Petrela has specialized in real assets and natural resources investing on behalf of institutional investors since 2001. Her track record includes more than $1 billion invested in agriculture across numerous geographies and investment structures. As the firm’s Chief Investment Officer, Ms. Petrela leads the Investment Committee for each Red Reef fund. Prior to Red Reef, Ms. Petrela oversaw Ospraie’s global private investment effort in agriculture. She led two of Ospraie’s largest private equity investments, Adecoagro and Teays River Investments, and was involved in the acquisition of Gavilon. Ms. Petrela oversaw the inception of the Special Opportunity Fund's new agricultural real estate fund management business in partnership with Teays. She served as a Director and member of the Compensation Committee of the Board of Teays, and as a Director and member of the Audit Committee of the Board of Adecoagro. Before Ospraie, Ms. Petrela was a private equity Principal with Soros Fund Management/Grove International Partners, where she managed real estate investments internationally. Prior to Soros, she was a private equity Associate with TD Capital and a mergers and acquisitions Analyst with Salomon Brothers, where she specialized in real assets, energy, and natural resources. Ms. Petrela has been featured as an expert agricultural investor in Forbes, Reuters, Institutional Investor Foundation & Endowment Intelligence, PEI Alternative Insight Global Agri Investor, AgAdvance Journal, the Fidelity Family Office Direct Investment Summit, Global AgInvest Conference, Women’s Alternative Investment Summit, PEI Agri Investor Forum, and Barclays Capital Commodities Investor Conference. She co-authored a real estate investing case study published by Harvard Business School Press and taught in the MBA curricula at Harvard and Columbia business schools. Ms. Petrela holds an Honors BA in Economics from the University of Toronto, summa cum laude , and an MBA from Harvard Business School. Scott Henry Partner, Investment Management Bio Scott Henry oversees investments for Red Reef. Mr. Henry joined the firm following several years as a Business Development Manager with LongView Farms, an innovative row and specialty crop farming company in Iowa owned by the Henry family that owns and operates more than 10,000 acres of annual and specialty crop farmland. Before Red Reef, Mr. Henry was a key member of LongView’s operational team, where he developed partnerships with Bayer, Pioneer, and AgReliant Genetics, and implemented advanced agronomic practices, standard operating procedures and information systems in field operations. Additionally, he managed budgeting, capital allocation, and strategic investment analyses for Board-level decisions. Prior to LongView, Mr. Henry managed farmland and livestock investments for Summit Agricultural Group, where he sourced and negotiated transactions, and managed due diligence and portfolio operations. Before Summit, he was an Analyst with Farm Credit Services of America and Adayana Agribusiness Group, where he focused on farm appraisals, crop insurance and credit underwriting. Mr. Henry serves as a member of the Farmer Advisory Board of the Environmental Defense Fund. Mr. Henry holds an MSc in Agricultural Economics from Purdue University, a BSc in Finance, Agricultural Business & International Agricultural from Iowa State University, and an MBA from the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University. Otto Ullrich Partner, Investment Management Bio Otto Ullrich oversees investments for Red Reef. Mr. Ullrich has extensive experience and relationships in U.S. farmland acquisitions and management, and the development of utility scale renewable energy projects. He has purchased, sold, and brokered farmland transactions for more than 20 years, completing over $145 million of agricultural land transactions, primarily in the midwestern U.S. and Florida. Mr. Ullrich is an experienced farm owner and manager who has successfully implemented value-add strategies including pasture-to-cropland conversions, drainage improvements, natural gas storage leases, livestock integrations, large scale solar developments, carbon sequestration, and transitioning agricultural lands to higher uses, including residential, commercial, and renewable energy use. Prior to joining Red Reef, Mr. Ullrich was a sourcing partner to Red Reef through Emerald Land Company, an agricultural land brokerage he founded in 2005, focused on large-scale agricultural properties in Illinois, Iowa, South Dakota, and Minnesota. Mr. Ullrich holds a BSc in Finance and an MBA from Western Illinois University. Andrew Ledwell Partner, Operations Bio Andrew Ledwell oversees Red Reef’s business operations related to asset management, including technology and systems for communications, cybersecurity, research, analytics, data storage, general IT, and third-party service providers. Mr. Ledwell has extensive experience in IT, operations and systems management from his career prior to Red Reef with IBM and EMC/Pivotal in the U.S. and Canada, where he was a top 1% performer and member of the IBM Global Placement Program for top talent. At IBM and EMC/Pivotal, Mr. Ledwell managed over $250 million of IT related sales and technical first deployments, coordinated large-scale projects with cross functional teams and specialized in developing customized solutions to support the operations of sophisticated private and public sector users including Environment Canada, the United States Department of Defense, and the Canadian Department of National Defense. Mr. Ledwell holds an Honors BA in Philosophy from the University of Ottawa and was a member of the Canadian Armed Forces. Red Reef’s leadership team is complemented by additional team members (15), its Board of Directors (4), and its industry Advisory Board (4). Farmland Investing, Private Investment Firm — Red Reef Partners 0 Skip to Content Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability LP Login Open Menu Close Menu Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability LP Login Open Menu Close Menu Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability LP Login Investing in the future of agriculture. Established in 2009, Red Reef Partners is an independent investment manager specialized in sustainable farmland investing with a track record of more than $1 billion invested. We deliver superior returns and portfolio resiliency while advancing sustainable food and energy production and improving local communities. UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY “U.S. farmland is a $4+ trillion asset class with extraordinary portfolio benefits and the ultimate impact investment. At Red Reef, we’ve built an experienced team of investment and operating professionals with shared values. We are committed to collaborating with local relationships and industry leaders to uncover special opportunities and deliver attractive risk-adjusted returns to investors.” —Suzanne Petrela, Managing Partner Red Reef Partners, LP Bank of America Tower 150 East Palmetto Park Road Boca Raton, Florida 33432 Home Strategy Investments Leadership Sustainability Investors Disclosures Contact This website (the “Website”) of Red Reef Partners, LP and its affiliates (collectively, “Red Reef”) is intended to introduce Red Reef and does not constitute an offer of any product or strategy.  Please see the terms and conditions of use for the terms of use of the Website and important disclaimers and disclosures. © 2024 Red Reef Partners, LP. ONTO THE SAND. THINK OF THAT FIRST STEP. ANYWHERE. AWAY FROM THE RULES AND CONSTRAINTS. TOWARDS COMFORT AND FREEDOM. THINK OF THAT FIRST STEP. IT’S THE ONE WE LIVE FOR. IT’S THE ONE WE DESIGN EVERY REEF PRODUCT TO MAKE THE MOST OF. THINK OF THAT FIRST STEP. NOW TAKE IT. Shop Men Shop Women OUR FOUNDERS STORY In 1984, two entrepreneurial brothers from South America named Fernando and Santiago Aguerre founded REEF out
          of a love for the beach and surfing. Their idea was to create high-quality, super comfortable products that
          fit the lifestyle they loved. Fernando and Santi walked everywhere, so they created sandals that could take
          them to the beach, into town, and wherever they wanted to go - in comfort. The brothers redefined, redesigned
          and reengineered every component of the sandals. That attention to detail and an uncompromising standard of
          quality made Reef the most comfortable sandals anybody had ever worn. The innovations that started in 1984
          have evolved into the Reef sandals we love today, becoming a symbol of a free, comfortable and happy
          lifestyle. PRICE THIS VENUE Provided by: Red Reef Park Report Red Reef Park FAVORITE Venue highlights Valet parking Venue details Style: Park/Garden, Outdoor Guest capacity: Accommodates up to 150 guests Services: Ceremony Outdoor VIEW OPTIONS Location: 1400 North Ocean Boulevard Boca Raton, FL 33432 Description: Can't decide between a beachfront or park ceremony for your South Florida nuptials? No need to settle on one or the other, Red Reef Park in Boca Raton offers you the best of both worlds. The 67-acre oceanfront park offers a picturesque setting perfect for your wedding day. Red Reef Park specializes in intimate outdoor ceremonies, of up to 100 guests. Your guests and photographer will marvel at the towering palm trees, freshly cut green grass, and stunning views of the Atlantic. And as you recite your vows you will feel the soft caress of a crisp ocean breeze. Smaller ceremonies can be held right on the sand. You and your guests can access the beach and the Atlantic Ocean from designated locations within the park. Larger ceremonies can be held in one of the park's impeccably-manicured lawn areas. Add an elegant touch of nature to your special day. The park is for ceremonies only. However, the nearby Count de Hoernie Pavilion Train Depot may be used as a complementary reception site. READ MORE Additional details Service Options Venue notes The rental fee is $504 for a ceremony only wedding and includes 1 hour of event time excluding set up and clean up time. Discounts apply for residents, please inquire with venue for details. Dismiss View all alerts Contact Us Contact Us For park information by mail, please write to: Information Packet Request Capitol Reef National Park HC 70 Box 15 Torrey, UT 84775 Please provide your complete mailing address and the type of information you would like to receive. You may download trip planners and other brochures from this website. For park information by phone, call: (435) 425-3791 Fax requests to: (435) 425-3026 E-mail: CARE Information Messages sent to this email address will receive replies, either by return email or by U.S. Mail, depending on the response required.  Based on the volume of emails we receive and staffing levels, in certain seasons it may take 7 to 10 days to receive a reply. The park Visitor Center is located at the junction of the park's Scenic Drive and Utah Highway 24. The physical address is 52 West Headquarters Drive, Torrey UT 84775 Last updated: October 25, 2019 Park footer Contact Info Mailing Address: HC 70, Box 15 Torrey, UT 84775 Phone: 435-425-3791 Recorded park information available 24 hours a day. Phones are answered when staff is available. If no one answers, please leave a message, your call will be returned. Questions may also be sent to care_information@nps.gov. INVESTORS DEBT INVESTORS GOVERNANCE CONTACT US CONTACT US We use cookies on our website to give you the most relevant experience by remembering your preferences and repeat visits. By clicking “Accept”, you consent to the use of ALL the cookies. However you may visit Cookie Settings to provide a controlled consent. Cookie settings REJECT ACCEPT Manage consent Close Privacy Overview This website uses cookies to improve your experience while you navigate through the website. Out of these cookies, the cookies that are categorized as necessary are stored on your browser as they are essential for the working of basic functionalities of the website. We also use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent. You also have the option to opt-out of these cookies. But opting out of some of these cookies may have an effect on your browsing experience. Necessary Necessary Always Enabled Necessary cookies are absolutely essential for the website to function properly. These cookies ensure basic functionalities and security features of the website, anonymously. Cookie Duration Description cookielawinfo-checkbox-advertisement 1 year Set by the GDPR Cookie Consent plugin, this cookie is used to record the user consent for the cookies in the "Advertisement" category . cookielawinfo-checkbox-analytics 11 months This cookie is set by GDPR Cookie Consent plugin. The cookie is used to store the user consent for the cookies in the category "Analytics". cookielawinfo-checkbox-functional 11 months The cookie is set by GDPR cookie consent to record the user consent for the cookies in the category "Functional". cookielawinfo-checkbox-necessary 11 months This cookie is set by GDPR Cookie Consent plugin. The cookies is used to store the user consent for the cookies in the category "Necessary". cookielawinfo-checkbox-others 11 months This cookie is set by GDPR Cookie Consent plugin. The cookie is used to store the user consent for the cookies in the category "Other. cookielawinfo-checkbox-performance 11 months This cookie is set by GDPR Cookie Consent plugin. The cookie is used to store the user consent for the cookies in the category "Performance". elementor never This cookie is used by the website's WordPress theme. It allows the website owner to implement or change the website's content in real-time. viewed_cookie_policy 11 months The cookie is set by the GDPR Cookie Consent plugin and is used to store whether or not user has consented to the use of cookies. It does not store any personal data. Functional functional Functional cookies help to perform certain functionalities like sharing the content of the website on social media platforms, collect feedbacks, and other third-party features. Performance performance Performance cookies are used to understand and analyze the key performance indexes of the website which helps in delivering a better user experience for the visitors. Analytics analytics Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc. Cookie Duration Description _ga 2 years The _ga cookie, installed by Google Analytics, calculates visitor, session and campaign data and also keeps track of site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognize unique visitors. _gat_UA-179944158-6 1 minute A variation of the _gat cookie set by Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager to allow website owners to track visitor behaviour and measure site performance. The pattern element in the name contains the unique identity number of the account or website it relates to. _gid 1 day Installed by Google Analytics, _gid cookie stores information on how visitors use a website, while also creating an analytics report of the website's performance. Some of the data that are collected include the number of visitors, their source, and the pages they visit anonymously. CONSENT 2 years YouTube sets this cookie via embedded youtube-videos and registers anonymous statistical data. Advertisement advertisement Advertisement cookies are used to provide visitors with relevant ads and marketing campaigns. These cookies track visitors across websites and collect information to provide customized ads. Cookie Duration Description _fbp 3 months This cookie is set by Facebook to display advertisements when either on Facebook or on a digital platform powered by Facebook advertising, after visiting the website. fr 3 months Facebook sets this cookie to show relevant advertisements to users by tracking user behaviour across the web, on sites that have Facebook pixel or Facebook social plugin. VISITOR_INFO1_LIVE 5 months 27 days A cookie set by YouTube to measure bandwidth that determines whether the user gets the new or old player interface. YSC session YSC cookie is set by Youtube and is used to track the views of embedded videos on Youtube pages. yt-remote-connected-devices never YouTube sets this cookie to store the video preferences of the user using embedded YouTube video. yt-remote-device-id never YouTube sets this cookie to store the video preferences of the user using embedded YouTube video. Others others Other uncategorized cookies are those that are being analyzed and have not been classified into a category as yet. Cookie Duration Description browserupdateorg 7 days No description available. Save & Accept
